snippet: The Montreal, Maine and Atlantic Railway, part of Rail World Inc., was benefiting from a contract to move oil from North Dakota to New Brunswick, Canada, before last week’s train disaster in Quebec.
abstract: Rail World Inc, operator of runaway train of oil tankers that exploded in town of Lac Megantic, Quebec, killing 28 people and leaving 22 others missing and presumed dead, had benefited from contract to move oil from North Dakota to Canada; owner Edward A Burkhardt, target of public ire following disaster, says company will muster on.
lead_paragraph: The Montreal, Maine and Atlantic Railway, part of Rail World Inc., was benefiting from a contract to move oil from North Dakota to New Brunswick, Canada, before last week’s train disaster in Quebec.

headline.main: Before Blast, Hauling Oil Revived a Tiny Railroad
headline.print_headline: Before Blast, Hauling Oil Revived a Tiny Railroad
